doc.title: Gblocks

description.text: Selection of conserved blocks from multiple sequence alignment

doc.reference: Castresana, J. (2000). Selection of conserved blocks from multiple alignments for their use in phylogenetic analysis. Molecular Biology and Evolution 17, 540-552
Talavera, G., and Castresana, J. (2007). Improvement of phylogenies after removing divergent and ambiguously aligned blocks from protein sequence alignments. Systematic Biology 56, 564-577

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: FASTA-formatted alignments are accepted by gblocks. There is no limit for the number of sequences or positions in the alignment as long as there is enough memory available for the program.

xhtml:div.label:
Type of sequence (-t)?
Automatic Protein DNA
Automatic: For FASTA-formatted alignments, gblocks assigned the type Protein automatically.
In other cases, precise.

Minimum Number Of Sequences For A Conserved Position(-b1)?
Any integer BIGGER than half the number of sequences and SMALLER OR EQUAL than the total number of sequences. If you put an integer not in this interval, gblocks will run the program with default value, check the warning in output.
By default, = 50% of the number of sequences +1.

Minimum Number Of Sequences For A Flank Position(-b2)?
Any integer EQUAL OR SMALLER than Minimum Number Of Sequences For A Conserved Position. If you put an integer not in this interval, gblocks will run the program with default value, check the warning in output.
By default, = 85% of the number of sequences.

Minimum Length Of A Block(-b4)?
Any integer equal or bigger than 2 (= 10 by default).

Allowed Gap Positions (-b5)?
None With Half All
None(default value): No gap positions are allowed in the final alignment.
With Half: Positions with a gap in less than 50% of the sequences selected in the final alignment (if they're in an appropriate block).
All: Positions with gaps are not treated differently from others positions.

Maximum Number Of Contiguous Nonconserved Positions(-b3)?
All segment with contiguous non-conserved positions bigger than this value is rejected (=8 by default).

Selected Blocks (-s)?
Yes No
Saving or Not the alignment file with the selected blocks.

Results And Parameters File(-p)?
Yes Text Short Text No
Saving an HTML file (Yes), saving a text file (Text), saving a short text file (Short Text) or not saving any of them (No).
With the first two options the original file is shown with the selected blocks underlined and, in the HTML file, with colored conserved positions.
The parameters used and the flank positions of the selected blocks are written in these files.

Characters Per Line In Results And Parameters File (>50)(-v)?
Number of characters per line in the alignment shown in the Results And Parameters File.
Any integer bigger than 50 is accepted (60 by default).

NonConserved Blocks (-n)?
Yes No
Saving or Not a the alignment file with the blocks NOT selected (i.e., the complementary of the selected blocks).

Ungapped Alignment (-u)?
Yes No
Saving or Not the alignment file where only gap positions (i.e. positions with at least one gap) have been removed.

Mask File With The Selected Blocks (-k)?
Yes No
Saving or Not a file that can be read by the program SeqPup.
In this file, conserved positions as defined by Gblocks are shadowed and selected blocks underlined

Postscript File With The Selected Blocks (-d)?
Yes No
Saving or Not a Postscript file that shows schematically the selected blocks. You need a postscript viewer or editor to view this file.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: FASTA-formatted alignments are accepted by gblocks. There is no limit for the number of sequences or positions in the alignment as long as there is enough memory available for the program.
Automatic: For FASTA-formatted alignments, gblocks assigned the type Protein automatically.
In other cases, precise.

By default, = 50% of the number of sequences +1.

Any integer EQUAL OR SMALLER than Minimum Number Of Sequences For A Conserved Position. If you put an integer not in this interval, gblocks will run the program with default value, check the warning in output.
By default, = 85% of the number of sequences.
Any integer equal or bigger than 2 (= 10 by default).

All: Positions with gaps are not treated differently from others positions.
All segment with contiguous non-conserved positions bigger than this value is rejected (=8 by default).

The parameters used and the flank positions of the selected blocks are written in these files.
